1.text: Turn off your monitor to prevent screen damage.

2.text: Grab a clean, dry microfiber cloth.

3.text: Sweep the cloth gently across the top of the screen in 1 smooth motion.

4.text: Continue using smooth strokes as you work your way to the bottom.

5.text: Check the user manual before using liquids on LCD screens.

6.text: Power down the monitor and unplug the device to avoid damage.

7.text: Wipe the screen with a dampened lint-free cloth for a safe option.

8.text: Use a solution of dish soap and water if plain water doesn't work.

9.text: Moisten a lint-free cloth with LCD cleaner to remove stubborn smudges.

10.text: Get rid of tough dirt and stickiness with a vinegar and water solution.

11.text: Use a Lysol wipe to destroy bacteria on a glass-coated LCD screen.
